alert.note: Alert for Eastern Culberson County; Gaines; Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet; Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 15 at 2:31AM CST until December 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY AS LOW AS 16 PERCENT, 20FT WINDS OF 25 MPH OR MORE, AND VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR THE SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO PLAINS, SACRAMENTO FOOTHILLS, GUADALUPE MOUNTAINS, GAINES COUNTY AND PORTIONS OF CULBERSON COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa has issued a Red Flag Warning for humidity as low as 16% and 20ft winds of 25 mph or more, which is in effect from 11 AM CST /10 AM MST/ this morning to 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Gaines, Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains, Chaves Plains, Eddy Plains, Lea, Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet, Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains and Eastern Culberson County. * TIMING...This afternoon through this evening. * WINDS...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph for the plains. West winds 45 to 55 mph with gusts up to 70 mph for the Guadalupe Mountains. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 16 percent. * RFTI...2 to 4 or near critical to critical. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions will have the potential to grow into dangerous wind-driven wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Culberson County; Gaines; Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet; Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains
